result.execSummary:
The defendant Chris Darnel Hiemstra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Must complete programming through restorative justice. Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

timeConds.notes: Court grants Huber/work release. Court grants 126 day credit to be applied towards conditional jail sentence.

Clerked by CS
Defendant Chris Darnel Hiemstra in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Defendant Chris Darnel Hiemstra in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 15CF137 AND 15CF103. 

15CF103: State requests Court to accept the Amended Information amending Count 1 to Criminal Trespass to Dwelling (Class A misdemeanor). Court accepts Amended Information filed by State. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed. Defendant pleads guilty to amended charge.

15CF137: Defendant pleads guilty to Count 3. 

Court orders PSI.

Bond continues.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Chris Darnel Hiemstra in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Defendant Chris Darnel Hiemstra in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Information received. Formal reading waived. Not guilty pleas to all counts.
JAIL FAXED  Plea hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

COVERS 15CF135, 15CF136, 15CF137, 15CF138, 15CF139.

15CF138: Court calls case 15CF138 first to contact Attorney Kate Mary Murtaugh by phone. Defendant Kari J Hislop in court with attorney Kate Mary Murtaugh by phone.  Defendant Kari J Hislop in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives time limits. Court finds good cause to reset to April 30, 2015 at 3:00 p.m. for 15 minutes to allow attorney Murtaugh to be present to represent defendant. Defendant returned to jail at 3:52 pm. 

15CF135: Defendant Jeffrey W Dean in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Defendant Jeffrey W Dean in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CF136: Defendant Eva A Felton in court with attorney John M. O'Boyle.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CF137: Defendant Chris Darnel Hiemstra in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Defendant Chris Darnel Hiemstra in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CF139: Defendant Richard K Stensrud in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Richard K Stensrud in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:53 Detective Jason Olson, Barron Sheriff's Department, called, sworn and direct by State.  Witness identifies Defendant Jeffrey W Dean, Defendant Chris Darnel Hiemstra, Defendant Richard K Stensrud, and Defendant Eva A Felton.
4:05 No cross by Attorney Bachman.
4:05 Cross by Attorney Schlough.
4:06 Cross by Attorney Raymond.
4:11 Cross by Attorney O'Boyle.
 
15CF135: Court finds probable cause and binds defendant Jeffrey W Dean over.
15CF137: Court finds probable cause and binds defendant Chris Darnel Hiemstra over.
15CF139: Court finds probable cause and binds defendant Richard K Stensrud over.
15CF136: Arguments by Attorney O'Boyle and State. Court does not find probable cause, but binds Defendant Eva A Felton over for a misdemeanor. 

15CF135, 15CF136, 15CF137, 15CF139: All cases reset for May 13, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.



  Arraignment scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.
Must have no contact with Jason S or his residence.

Defendant Chris Darnel Hiemstra in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Chris Darnel Hiemstra in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
